intro: Cyphostemma eminii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, followed by distinctive, inflated fruit capsules. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in shrublands and woodlands. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
